The claim made by Brett McGurk: a former special envoy for the coalition to counter the Islamic State, states that President Trump has sent 14,000 American troops to the Middle East region since May.
The Pentagon confirmed in an Oct: 11 press release that they have increased the number of forces by approximately 14,000 to the U.S. Central Command area of responsibility since May.
The term: area of responsibility" refers to the entire Middle East, according to the Pentagon. However, it may also include Afghanistan and other parts of central Asia, as stated by Will Todman, an associate fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
The recent reduction of U: S. troops in Afghanistan suggests that more troops have likely been deployed to the Middle East, supporting McGurk's claim that Trump has sent 14 times as many soldiers to the region as he pledged to remove when announcing the decision to pull out of Syria.
